newsitem.title: REPUBLIC OF IRELAND: Horse Racing-Mantovani is Irish top two-year-old.
newsitem.headline: Horse Racing-Mantovani is Irish top two-year-old.

text.p: Jim Bolger-trained Mantovani was Ireland's champion two-year-old for 1996, according to the Irish racing classifications released on Thursday.
The Irish classifications said Mantovani had achieved champion two-year-old status with a win in the Group One Heinz Phoenix Stakes at Leopardstown in August.
Bolger said he hoped that Mantovani, rated 116, will be a serious Classic contender at a mile in 1997.
Dermot Weld's Irish Derby winner Zagbreb was Ireland's champion three year-old for 1996, the Irish classifications said.
Pat Shanahan-ridden Zagreb, rated 125, gave Weld his first triumph in Ireland's premier Classic.
Weld said Zagreb may reappear in the Dubai World Cup, the prestigious international event won in 1996 by American star Cigar.
Kevin Prendergast's Oscar Schindler and John Oxx-trained triple Group One heroine Timarida were joint champions in the older age group, the classifications said.
Oscar Schindler, rated 124, won the Group One Irish St.Leger and then went on to finish a creditable third to the top rated European horse in 1996, Helissio, in the Prix de l'Arc de Triomphe.
In addition, Oscar Schindler was the highest rated stayer in all age groups in the 1996 international classifications.
Oxx's Timarida, rated 124, succeeded her former stable companion Ridgewood Pearl as the top rated filly of her generation in Europe.
Timarida won Group One races in three different countries, Germany, USA and Ireland (Irish Champion Stakes) in 1996.
